page.title: 04Communications In Middleton
page.content: Newspapers are delivered daily by village children employed by a Youlgrave newsagent. Papers delivered are Express - 7: Mail - 5: Telegraph - 4: Guardian - 3: Sun - 3: Mirror - 3: Times - 3: Star - 1. There are two postal deliveries and collections daily. A mobile library visits the village fortnightly. A survey in the village found that 80% of people use newspapers to gain information about what is happening in the world. Almost everyone has a television but only 56% use TV and only 32% use radio for news. The postal service is used by 68% and the telephone by 56%. Only a small percentage of homes have video recorders and even fewer use the mobile library.
